bibl.title: Ptolemaic Stamped Handles from Judah.
bibl.note: "In summary, this paper has attempted to establish as a viable hypothesis that the yhd-plus-symbol and Jerusalem seals were used by officials of - most likely - Ptolemy III Euergetes (247-221 B.C.) and the high priest Onias II, respectively, in collecting taxes in kind from the people of Judah."
bibl.seg: Lapp Paul W., Ptolemaic Stamped Handles from Judah.

"In summary, this paper has attempted to establish as a viable hypothesis that the yhd-plus-symbol and Jerusalem seals were used by officials of - most likely - Ptolemy III Euergetes (247-221 B.C.) and the high priest Onias II, respectively, in collecting taxes in kind from the people of Judah."
